content.question: ​The function <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3 csc open parentheses pi open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses close parentheses minus 1"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>csc</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following describes the range of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​The range of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open square brackets negative 3 , 3 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3,3</mn></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​​The range of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses negative infinity comma negative 2 close square brackets union open square brackets 4 comma infinity close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfenced close="]"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>∪</mo><mfenced open="["><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​The range of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses negative infinity comma negative 3 close square brackets union open square brackets 3 comma infinity close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfenced close="]"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>∪</mo><mfenced open="["><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​​The range of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses negative infinity comma negative 4 close square brackets union open square brackets 2 comma infinity close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfenced close="]"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>∪</mo><mfenced open="["><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: ​​​The range of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses negative infinity comma negative 4 close square brackets union open square brackets 2 comma infinity close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfenced close="]"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>∪</mo><mfenced open="["><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

topic.text: 3.11: The Secant, Cosecant, and Cotangent Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
